statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

video.headline: Gordon Nets 17 In Massachusetts Win
video.caption: Derrick Gordon became the first openly gay Division I men's basketball player to compete in a collegiate game, scoring 17 points in Massachusetts' 95-87 win over Siena.
video.description: Derrick Gordon became the first openly gay Division I men's basketball player to compete in a collegiate game, scoring 17 points in Massachusetts' 95-87 win over Siena.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCB Highlight (Derrick Gordon's first game) 2014/11/14 ESHEET

video.title: Gordon Nets 17 In Massachusetts Win

article.headline: UMass over Siena 95-87

images.name: Gordon Nets 17 In Massachusetts Win
images.caption: Derrick Gordon became the first openly gay Division I men's basketball player to compete in a collegiate game, scoring 17 points in Massachusetts' 95-87 win over Siena.

article.story:
AMHERST, Mass. -- Trey Davis scored 28 points with four assists as Massachusetts beat Siena 95-87 in the season opener for both teams on Friday night.

Maxie Esho had 21 points and nine rebounds and Cady Lalanne scored 15 points and led the team with 10 rebounds. Derrick Gordon added 17 points for the Minutemen. The team shot 45.5 percent from the field and 75 percent from the line.

Siena led 41-36 at the break. But the Minutemen came back as the Saints sent them to the line 33 times overall where UMass was on fire with Davis hitting 12 of 17, Gordon hitting 11 of 12, and Esho sinking 5 of 8.

Rob Poole led the Saints with 19 points and nine rebounds. Ryan Oliver had 14 points and four rebounds and Patrick Cole added 12 points and three rebounds.

videos.headline: Gordon Nets 17 In Massachusetts Win
videos.description: Derrick Gordon became the first openly gay Division I men's basketball player to compete in a collegiate game, scoring 17 points in Massachusetts' 95-87 win over Siena.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCB Highlight (Derrick Gordon's first game) 2014/11/14 ESHEET
